title: Where to watch the Rugby World Cup 2019 – the best sports bars and venues showing the semi-finals across the UK
text:
The ninth Rugby World Cup, held in Japan, has reached the business end of proceedings: the semi-finals.

After a tournament of various dramas, two Home Nations remain, England and Wales.

You'll need a good place to watch the action, of course, but it won't necessarily be easy, because Japan is eight hours ahead, meaning games will be kicking off early this weekend, both at 9am.

Not classic pub time, then, but a host of venues across the country will be opening up their doors in time for the crowds.

Saturday, 9am, England take on New Zealand; on Sunday at the same time, Wales tackle South Africa.
description: The ninth Rugby World Cup, held in Japan, has reached the business end of proceedings:
